column4: Can you repeat the question? I joined ~20 minutes ago and can't see it.
Ah, yes. Wine keeps evolving, making more and more windows programs runnable, but in the process, other programs stop working.
What's the appdb rating of those programs?
I found some articles that said to delete a certain DX9 file, but I don't have it.  Starcraft 2 is where my problems started.  I think it's rated gold or plat, I forget which.
After encountering an error in SCII I started getting the same error everywhere else.
Ah. Have you tried grabbing wine from winehq's repositories instead of Ubuntu's?
what's the repository? should I completely uninstall, then reinstall?

No, though if SC2 triggered it, maybe it removed a file it shouldn't or something like that. You could try installing one of the windows programs that suddenly started failing in a separate wineprefix and see if that works.
I don't know what that "executable bit" stuff is
speaking greek, man.  I'm trying to run a .exe that doesn't even require installation
when you click an .exe file ubuntu slaps you with an executable bit error, like windows saying that mother knows best, don't run exe files
Ok, for testing, open a terminal and run  mkdir /tmp/wine; export WINEPREFIX=/tmp/wine/test; wine /path/to/file.exe
It's important that you run wine from that same terminal, not from the file browser or anything.
i still get the error
want me to pastebin
No, the technical stuff in the error message will tell me nothing. Need to be a wine developer to parse that.
so should I put this up on #winehq
With patience, someone might.
Since it still didn't work with a fresh wineprefix, I don't think SC2 had anything to do with it.
I'm thinking it doesn't, either, every program I try fails.  SCII didn't even finish installing, I got the same error
Then perhaps the "executable bit" hack you were talking about could've triggered it?
